Example - subscribe to the "complete" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the value of the **ProgressBar** reaches the maximum value.> **Important** The event is not fired during the initialization of the widget, even when the initial value is equal to the maximum value.

children.name: change
Example - subscribe to the "change" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fired when the value of the **ProgressBar** has changed. If the progress animation is enabled, the event will be fired after the animation has completed (does not applies to chunk **ProgressBar**).

children.name: value
Example - setting the value of the ProgressBar
Example - getting the current ProgressBar value

children.description: Gets or sets the value of the **ProgressBar**. It accepts a number, a string or `false` as a parameter. Setting the value to `false` will set the state of the **ProgressBar** to indeterminate. If no parameter is passed, it returns the underlying value.

parameters.name: enable `Boolean`
parameters.description: The argument, which defines whether to enable/disable the **ProgressBar**. If no argument is passed, the widget will be enabled.

children.name: Example - set custom styles to the progress wrapper
value
Example - set the initial ProgressBar value

children.description: The underlying value of the **ProgressBar**. It should be a number or `false`. Setting the value to `false` will set the state of the ProgressBar to indeterminate.

children.name: type
Example - set the type of the ProgressBar

children.description: Specifies the type of the **ProgressBar**. The supported types are **value**, **percent** and **chunk**.> **Important** The **chunk** progress type is not supported in Internet Explorer 7.

children.name: showStatus
Example - hide the status of the ProgressBar

children.description: Specifies if the progress status will be shown.

children.name: reverse
children.description: Specifies if the progress direction will be reversed.

children.name: orientation
Example - specify vertical orientation for the ProgressBar

children.description: The orientation of the **ProgressBar**. Possible values are **horizontal** and **vertical**.

children.description: If set to `false` the widget will be disabled. It will still allow changing the value. The widget is enabled by default.

children.name: chunkCount

children.description: Specifies the number of chunks.> **Important** This property is applicable only when the type of the **ProgressBar** is set to **chunk**.

children.description: The duration of each progress animation in milliseconds.
